intro: Crypsinus senescens, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. The flowers, which come in a variety of colors, are often used in ornamental gardening due to their beauty and resilience.
